title: How to Make a Toilet Paper Roll Caterpillar

steps.headline: Cut each toilet paper roll in half.
steps.description: Make a total of eight halves.

steps.headline: Punch two holes in six of the tubes, one in front and one in back.
steps.description: The other two tubes will be the head and tail, so only punch one hole in each of these.

steps.headline: Paint the tubes any color you like.
Thread the piece of yarn through each of the holes in each of the tubes.
steps.description: Leave the yarn somewhat loose so that your caterpillar can move with ease. Tie off the ends of the yarn on the tail and head.

steps.headline: Pick out some construction paper and cut out two strips to use as antennae.
Fold and glue the antennae onto the top of the caterpillar's head.
Glue two googly eyes on the caterpillar's head.
steps.description: The caterpillar is now complete and ready to have some fun!

text: Preparing the Toilet Paper Rolls Cut each toilet paper roll in half. Make a total of eight halves. Punch two holes in six of the tubes, one in front and one in back. The other two tubes will be the head and tail, so only punch one hole in each of these. Paint the tubes any color you like.  Creating the Caterpillar Thread the piece of yarn through each of the holes in each of the tubes. Leave the yarn somewhat loose so that your caterpillar can move with ease. Tie off the ends of the yarn on the tail and head. Pick out some construction paper and cut out two strips to use as antennae.  Fold and glue the antennae onto the top of the caterpillar's head.  Glue two googly eyes on the caterpillar's head. The caterpillar is now complete and ready to have some fun!
